clarifications: When creating a GeoDataFrame, always specify the geometry column explicitly in the constructor: gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry='geometry_column_name') or use set_geometry() after construction.
Required imports: geopandas (as gpd), geoplot (as gplt), geoplot.crs as gcrs
Use geoplot.quadtree() with a GeoDataFrame that has an active geometry column set
For spatial joins and analysis, ensure geometry columns are properly set before operations
notes: This clarification addresses GeoDataFrame API deprecation warnings that agents cannot discover due to sandbox restrictions blocking geopandas imports during development.
